sen.j: 父の隆盛が武房より先に死去した後、菊池氏の家督は兄の時隆が武房の養嗣子となって継いだが、叔父の菊池武経がこれに不満を持って対立し、結果として時隆と武経が共に滅んだため、その後を継いで当主となった。
sen.e: After the death of his father, Takamori prior to that of Takefusa, his elder brother, Tokitaka became an adopted heir of Takefusa and succeeded to the family estate of the Kikuchi clan, however, his uncle, Taketsune KIKUCHI was not satisfied with this and was opposed to Tokitaka, consequently, both Tokitaka and Taketsune ruined, and he took over the family estate and became the family head.

sen.j: この頃の九州は、元寇の後に鎮西探題が設置され、北条氏による支配が強化されており、御家人達の不満は募っていた。
sen.e: In those days in Kyushu, the Chinzei tandai (office of the military governor of Kyushu) was established after the Mongol invasion of Japan, and the governance by the Hojo clan was reinforced, which collected the dissatisfaction of gokenins (immediate vassals of the shogunate in the Kamakura and Muromachi through Edo periods).

sen.j: 元弘3年/正慶2年（1333年）3月11日、博多に到着した武時は鎮西探題に出仕したが、侍所から遅参を非難され、口論となった。
sen.e: On March 11, 1333, Taketoki, who arrived at Hakata, served the Chinzei tandai, however, Samurai-dokoro (the Board of Retainers) blamed him for his late attendance, which developed into an argument.
On May 3, 1333, Taketoki, who arrived at Hakata, served in the Chinzei tandai, however, Samurai-dokoro (the Board of Retainers) blamed him for his late attendance, which developed into an argument.

sen.j: 13日、武時は挙兵し、博多の所々に火をつけて焼き払った。
sen.e: On the 13th day, Taketoki raised an army and set fire to several places in Hakata, and burned it away.
On the 5th day of the same month, Taketoki raised an army and set fire to several places in Hakata, and burned them away.
sen.cmt: 前の places を受けて、'burned it' を 'burned them' に変えました。日付をグレゴリオ暦に換算しました。

sen.j: そして少弐貞経、大友貞宗らに使者を使わし、隠岐国を脱出した後醍醐天皇の綸旨を受けているので同調するように告げる。
sen.e: Then, he sent an emissary to Sadatsune SHONI, Sadamune OTOMO, etc., and told them to side with him because he had received Rinji (the Emperor's command) of the emperor Godaigo who had escaped from Oki Province.

sen.j: しかし両者の反応は冷たく、少弐貞経は堅粕（福岡市博多区・東区）で菊池の使者を斬り、大友貞宗も使者を斬ろうとして逃走された。
sen.e: However, the both reacted coldly, and Sadatsune SHONI killed KIKUCHI's emissary at Katakasu (Hakata Ward, Higashi Ward, Fukuoka City), and Sadamune OTOMO also tried to kill the emissary, but had the emissary run away.

sen.j: 武時は鎮西探題に押し寄せ、探題配下と合戦となるが敗れ、子の菊池頼隆以下菊池一族と共に打たれた。
sen.e: Taketoki surged into the Chinzei tandai, and went into a battle with the subordinates of the tanadai, however, he was defeated and killed along with the Kikuchi family, including his son, Yoritaka KIKUCHI.

sen.j: 武時は探題で行われた裁判で敗訴していた事も挙兵の遠因とされている。

sen.j: その性急な挙兵は少弐氏や大友氏の支持を得られず、自滅する結果となるが、武時の探題襲撃計画は九州における討幕運動の契機となった。
sen.e: The rapid raising of an army could not get support of the Shoni clan and the Otomo clan, which resulted in his self-destruction, however, Taketoki's plan to attack the tandai triggered the anti-shogunate movement in Kyushu.

sen.e: In the Kenmu Restoration, Masashige KUSUNOKI praised that 'Taketoki was the most loyal subject who risked his life on the emperor (Emperor Godaigo),' and Takeshige KIKUCHI who succeeded to Taketoki was awarded a territory of Higo Province as reward grants.
